fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A report referred to the “refill zone” set up by a Waitrose store, where shoppers can use their own containers for products, as the first such trial by a major UK supermarket. That overlooked Morrisons, which has a similar trial in two Yorkshire stores (Waitrose hailed for trial of packaging-free food in Oxford supermarket, 4 June, page 12). • Other recently corrected articles include: LGBT lesson protests hijacked by religious extremists, MPs say A school’s mural removal: should kids be shielded from brutal US history? Players boycott Australian national anthem before State of Origin opener
